verses.verse: After<WH310> these<WH428> events<WH1697> King<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325> promoted<WH1431> Haman,<WH2001> the son<WH1121> of Hammedatha<WH9097> the Agagite,<WH91> and advanced<WH5375> him and established<WH7760> his authority<WH3678> over<WH4480> <WH5921> all<WH3605> the princes<WH8269> who<WH834> [were] with him.

And all<WH3605> the king<WH4428>'s servants<WH5650> who<WH834> were at the king's gate<WH8179> bowed<WH3766> down<WH3766> and paid<WH7812> homage<WH7812> to Haman;<WH2001> for so<WH3651> the king had commanded<WH6680> concerning him. But Mordecai<WH4782> neither<WH3808> bowed<WH3766> down<WH3766> nor<WH3808> paid<WH7812> homage.<WH7812>
Then the king's servants<WH5650> who<WH834> were at the king's gate<WH8179> said<WH559> to Mordecai,<WH4782> "Why<WH4069> are you transgressing<WH5674> the king's command<WH4687>?"

Now it was when they had spoken<WH559> daily<WH3117> to him and he would not listen<WH8085> to them, that they told<WH5046> Haman<WH2001> to see<WH7200> whether Mordecai's reason<WH1697> would stand;<WH5975> for he had told<WH5046> them that he was a Jew.<WH3064>
When Haman<WH2001> saw<WH7200> that Mordecai<WH4782> neither<WH369> bowed<WH3766> down<WH3766> nor<WH369> paid<WH7812> homage<WH7812> to him, Haman<WH2001> was filled<WH4390> with rage.<WH2534>

But he disdained<WH959> <WH5869> to lay<WH7971> hands<WH3027> on Mordecai<WH4782> alone,<WH905> for they had told<WH5046> him [who<WH834>] the people<WH5971> of Mordecai<WH4782> [were;] therefore Haman<WH2001> sought<WH1245> to destroy<WH8045> all<WH3605> the Jews,<WH3064> the people<WH5971> of Mordecai,<WH4782> who [were] throughout the whole<WH3605> kingdom<WH4438> of Ahasuerus.<WH325>

In the first<WH7223> month,<WH2320> which<WH1931> is the month<WH2320> Nisan,<WH5212> in the twelfth<WH8147> <WH6240> year<WH8141> of King<WH4428> Ahasuerus,<WH325> Pur,<WH6332> that is the lot,<WH1486> was cast<WH5307> before<WH6440> Haman<WH2001> from day<WH3117> to day<WH3117> and from month<WH2320> [to month<WH2320>] until the twelfth<WH8147> <WH6240> month,<WH2320> that is the month Adar.<WH143>

Then Haman<WH2001> said<WH559> to King<WH4428> Ahasuerus,<WH325> "There<WH3426> is a certain<WH259> people<WH5971> scattered<WH6340> and dispersed<WH6504> among<WH996> the peoples<WH5971> in all<WH3605> the provinces<WH4082> of your kingdom;<WH4438> their laws<WH1881> are different<WH8132> from [those] of all<WH3605> [other] people,<WH5971> and they do not observe<WH6213> the king's laws,<WH1881> so it is not in the king's interest<WH9586> to let them remain.<WH5117>

"If<WH518> it is pleasing<WH2895> to the king,<WH4428> let it be decreed<WH3789> that they be destroyed, and I will pay<WH6> ten<WH8254> thousand<WH6235> talents<WH505> of silver<WH3603> into the hands<WH3701> of those who carry<WH3027> on the [king's] business,<WH6213> to put<WH4399> into the king's treasuries.<WH935>"

Then the king<WH4428> took<WH5493> his signet<WH2885> ring<WH2885> from his hand<WH3027> and gave<WH5414> it to Haman,<WH2001> the son<WH1121> of Hammedatha<WH9097> the Agagite,<WH91> the enemy<WH6887> of the Jews.<WH3064>
And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Haman,<WH2001> "The silver<WH3701> is yours,<WH5414> and the people<WH5971> [also,] to do<WH6213> with them as you please.<WH2896> <WH5869>"

Then the king<WH4428>'s scribes<WH9373> were summoned<WH7121> on the thirteenth<WH7969> <WH6240> day<WH3117> of the first<WH7223> month,<WH2320> and it was written<WH3789> just<WH3605> <WH834> as Haman<WH2001> commanded<WH6680> to the king's satraps,<WH323> to the governors<WH6346> who<WH834> were over<WH5921> each<WH4082> province,<WH4082> and to the princes<WH8269> of each<WH5971> people,<WH5971> each<WH4082> province<WH4082> according to its script,<WH3791> each<WH5971> people<WH5971> according to its language,<WH3956> being written<WH3789> in the name<WH8034> of King Ahasuerus<WH325> and sealed<WH2856> with the king's signet<WH2885> ring.<WH2885>

And letters<WH5612> were sent<WH7971> by couriers<WH7323> to all<WH3605> the king's provinces<WH4082> to destroy,<WH8045> to kill,<WH2026> and to annihilate all<WH6> the Jews,<WH3605> both<WH3064> young<WH4480> and old,<WH5288> women<WH2205> and children,<WH802> in one<WH2945> day,<WH259> the thirteenth<WH3117> <WH7969> [day] of the twelfth<WH6240> <WH8147> month,<WH6240> which<WH2320> is the month<WH1931> Adar,<WH2320> and to seize<WH143> their possessions<WH962> as plunder.<WH7998>

A copy<WH6572> of the edict<WH3791> to be issued<WH5414> as law<WH1881> in every<WH3605> province<WH4082> was published<WH1540> to all<WH3605> the peoples<WH5971> so that they should be ready<WH6264> for this<WH2088> day.<WH3117>

The couriers<WH7323> went<WH3318> out impelled<WH1765> by the king<WH4428>'s command<WH1697> while the decree<WH1881> was issued<WH5414> in Susa<WH7800> the capital;<WH1002> and while the king and Haman<WH2001> sat<WH3427> down<WH3427> to drink,<WH8354> the city<WH5892> of Susa<WH7800> was in confusion.<WH943>
